page.title: 18FARMING
page.content: MOST OF THE LAND IN THE AREA IS DIVIDED INTO FAMILY UNITS-BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ACRES GROWING A VARIETY OF CROPS TO SPREAD THE WORKLOAD EVENLY THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. SOME FARMS HAVE A SMALL AREA UNDER GLASS WHICH REQUIRES MORE MANUAL WORK. DURING WINTER MONTHS DAFFODILS AND TULIPS ARE FORCED IN GLASSHOUSES AND SOLD IN TOWNS AND CITIES.THEN COMES TOMATOES AND CUCUMBERS OR LILLIES.SOME SMALLHOLDERS CONCENTRATE ON GROWING CHRYSANTEMUMS OVER A LONG PERIOD. A VARIETY OF CROPS ARE PRODUCED ON THESE SMALL FAMILY FARMS SUCH AS WHEAT BARLEY PEAS ONIONS POTATOES AND SUGAR BEET ALSO BULBS AND STRAWBERRIES.THERE ARE SOME LARGER FARMS PRODUCING CEREALS AND OILSEED RAPE USING LARGE MACHINERY WHICH REQUIRES BIG FIELDS AND A SMALL LABOUR FORCE.
